meta.label: EKS clusters
meta.description: Interact with Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service clusters
meta.author: Dataiku

params.name: defParams
params.label: DSS Cluster-wide Instance Types Available for Use
params.description: Use these parameters to restrict what Instance Types are available when building node groups. This configuration only restricts the selection of specific nodes in the lists. If a node group has built already, these parameters will not stop

params.name: instanceFamily
params.label: Instance Families
params.description: Choose the AWS Instance Families to be returned when building node pools.

selectChoices.label: Z Family - High Memory - High Compute

params.name: instanceVCPUsMin
params.label: Min vCPUs
params.description: Minimum Number of vCPUs an Instance Type can have (will be set to 2 if not selected).

params.name: instanceVCPUsMax
params.label: Max vCPUs
params.description: Maximum Number of vCPUs an Instance Type.

params.name: memoryMin
params.label: Min Memory
params.description: Minimum Memory (GB) of an Instance Type (will be set to 4 if not selected).

params.name: memoryMax
params.label: Max Memory
params.description: Maximum Memory (GB) of an Instance Type.

params.name: defParams2
params.label: Nodegroup Creation Checks
params.description: These parameters will be enforced when a node group is attached to a cluster.

params.name: alwaysSpot
params.label: Always Run Node groups as Spot
params.description: Making this selection will create all nodegroups as Spot instances. While these have significant cost savings ~80% to 90%, your job can be stopped if nodes are needed elsewhere in AWS. If you intend to run jobs that cannot be interrupted, do not select this option. As an alternative, select the Run As Spot option when building individual node groups to run Spot and On-Demand instances within the same cluster.

params.name: alwaysDSSZone
params.label: Always Run Nodegroups in the DSS Availability Zone
params.description: Making this selection will create all EC2 instances in the cluster in the same region and availability zone as DSS. This reduces network transfer costs between DSS and the cluster at the expense of reducing the pool of potential node types.
